args.value: === SECTION 1: WHAT OUR INTERPRETER CAN DO ===
The following code examples are COMMENTED OUT because they will fail.
Uncomment them to see the errors.
setmetatable(t, mt) -- exists but doesn't work
getmetatable(t) -- exists but always returns nil
(The parser accepts it, but evaluator ignores it)
a ~ b   (bitwise XOR) -- note: unary ~ works
(Evaluator supports them, but parser doesn't parse them)
Total: Our interpreter handles core Lua well!
Missing: Standard libraries (table, string, math, io, os)
